title: A lot of reprocessing promt.
body:
hi

First of all, I love your extension. I use local models (koboltcpp) and I noticed that after some time (5k tokens sometimes less) there is a lot of reprocessing (not so much when generating thoughts or plans, but afterwards).

There is a setting in your extension "Number of included thoughts for a character:" significantly increasing this number eliminates the processing problem. I don't quite understand how it works, why is the default value only "2"? When generating text (after generating thoughts and plans) is only the part of the previous conversation taken into account? (this would explain the reprocessing)
author: Danik-droid

comments.body:
Hi,

First of all, thank you! I'm glad to hear that you like the extension.

As for the so-called reprocessing, it happens because, after thoughts are generated, the API reloads the entire context. Why does this happen? Because some thoughts are evicted from the context after a new message is generated. In other words, the context changes somewhere in the middle, making it impossible to execute a Context Shift. There is no way to avoid this unless you disable eviction by setting a large value for "Number of included thoughts for a character."

Why is it set to 2 by default? Well, some models tend to confuse thoughts with regular messages if there are too many thoughts in the context. Additionally, they can become rigid, sticking to the initial thoughts and not altering them enough as the chat continues. Old thoughts may also become less useful, so keeping them could be considered a waste of context.

However, in your case, if your model handles thoughts well and speed is a top priority for you, using a large number for "Number of included thoughts for a character" is perfectly fine. That's why the setting is configurable after all ðŸ™‚

I see... That makes sense, llama 8b actually started to get a bit lost after a while... Mistral small copes well with a lot of "Number of included thoughts for a character.", but you're right that characters are more stubborn when you increase this value - which can be annoying. (they can bring up things that happened much much earlier, which is interesting but often tiring)...

It doesn't occur to me how this could be easily solved... I wondered earlier what it would be like to assign another model to do the thinking and planning, but now I know that it would not contribute anything to the topic of reprocessing.

Thank you very much for your answer. Oh well... I guess I need to work on my patience, because without your expansion, roleplay is losing a lot.
Sure, if you need any help, please feel free to ask.

title: Prompt Inspector shows dev branch thoughts/plans not submitted for final generation
body:
Using latest dev branch, stepped thinking not showing in extensions list and no thinking happens on latest commit: 2dab25c3989a202d8e589eddfb4fa6e77cb8e2bc

I was using the commit from 2 days ago as well, 11ee9e1234a04208aaa2dbfedbc30c637fc97326 and love how the thinking and plans show up now... But using prompt inspector, it seems the final thoughts and plans never actually got sent after thinking generation. The generation prompt with the examples got submitted, then the thinking gets submitted to develop plans, the  in the final generation nothing stepped thinking wise is submitted for the actual response. 

Love the extension btw!  Are you planning to keep it to where only the latest iteration of thinking is sent to the prompt? Would love to have the thoughts/plans remain visible, and maybe toggle between only latest thoughts/plans are submitted or all of them, or maybe some of them? (Not sure what use it would be to have the last 5 for example sent and the rest excluded from the prompt.)
author: skatardude10

comments.body:
I am glad to hear that you like the extension! â¤ï¸ 

However, I strongly advise against using the dev branch. It contains an intermediate state of my current work and is **extremely** unstable. Please wait for the next release if you want a consistent experience.

> Are you planning to keep it to where only the latest iteration of thinking is sent to the prompt?

Yes, this is what I have in my mind right now.

> Would love to have the thoughts/plans remain visible

You will be able to leave them visible if you'd like, no worries.

> maybe toggle between only latest thoughts/plans are submitted or all of them, or maybe some of them

You can configure the number of latest thoughts/plans to submit using the "Number of included thoughts for a character" setting. I might add more flexibility later, but that's not my current focus.
